title: mlflow ui fails to load artifacts when using custom backend-store-uri and default-artifact-root

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
I am willing to contribute, but after chasing the bug for a while I encountered a dead end.
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: Yes, I have a custom python script that uses the mlflow api to train models.
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pip install
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.23.1
- **Python version**: 3.8.0
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
When using a custom tracking_uri, registry_uri and artifact_location when training and logging the model to mlflow, the mlflow ui will fail to load the artifact, even when provided the exact same parameters, and the server throws a stacktrace.

mlflow ui should correctly load artifacts that are stored at non-default locations, given its commandline parameters.

### Code to reproduce issue
I can work on a repro case in the future, but I hope the provided information below is enough for a knowledgable person to fix the issue without a repro. I already did quite some debugging.

### Other info / logs

The actual error of retrieving the artifact is evident by the stacktrace that appears in the console that executes the mlflow ui command:

    2022/02/17 13:05:59 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /model-versions/get-artifact [GET]
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 2452, in wsgi_app
        response = self.full_dispatch_request()
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1957, in full_dispatch_request
        rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1821, in handle_user_exception
        reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\_compat.py", line 39, in reraise
        raise value
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1951, in full_dispatch_request
        rv = self.dispatch_request()
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1936, in dispatch_request
        return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\server\__init__.py", line 59, in serve_model_version_artifact
        return get_model_version_artifact_handler()
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\server\handlers.py", line 244, in wrapper
        return func(*args, **kwargs)
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\server\handlers.py", line 304, in wrapper
        return func(*args, **kwargs)
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\server\handlers.py", line 826, in get_model_version_artifact_handler
        return _send_artifact(get_artifact_repository(artifact_uri), request_dict["path"])
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\server\handlers.py", line 227, in _send_artifact
        filename = os.path.abspath(artifact_repository.download_artifacts(path))
      File "c:\users\svbernem\appdata\local\programs\python\python38\lib\site-packages\mlflow\store\artifact\local_artifact_repo.py", line 82, in download_artifacts
        raise IOError("No such file or directory: '{}'".format(local_artifact_path))
    OSError: No such file or directory: 'mlflow_data\run_data\2a2b2eabc799465495890f2636c95784\artifacts\model\MLmodel'

mlflow tries to load the model `mlflow_data\run_data\2a2b2eabc799465495890f2636c95784\artifacts\model\MLmodel`, when the actual model is located at `mlflow_data\run_data\2a2b2eabc799465495890f2636c95784\artifacts\model`, so `MLmodel` is wrongfully appended to the path.

mlflow ui is called like this: `mlflow ui --backend-store-uri=sqlite:///registry_and_metadata.db --default-artifact-root=run_data`, and during training, relevant mlflow options are set like this:

        mlflow.set_tracking_uri("sqlite:///registry_and_metadata.db")
        mlflow.set_registry_uri("sqlite:///registry_and_metadata.db")
        [...]
        mlflow.create_experiment("2022-02-17-Experiment", "run_data")
        [...]
        mlflow.pyfunc.log_model("model", [...] registered_model_name="model")

There are couple of different symptoms caused by this, for example that there is no schema shown here, even though this model has one:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10748498/154478208-454dad1b-c784-4d19-8a9c-aff87ed34aa8.png)
which, I suspect, happens because of this failed query:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10748498/154481091-c69f8396-4471-4f91-97d0-de05fcd87578.png)


Chasing the issue through the python code, I also pinned the origin of the `MLmodel` path to this query, where the clientside javascript sets it as the as the `path` URL-parameter:

    http://localhost:5000/model-versions/get-artifact?path=MLmodel&name=model&version=5

I'm a total javascript noob, so the trail ended there for me pretty quickly.


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [x] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [x] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [x] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
